description: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) (n >= 0, 0<=k<=n) gives number of {0,1} n X n matrices with all row and column sums equal to k.
comments: Or, triangle of multipermutation numbers T(n,k), n >= 0, 0<=k<=n: number of relations on an n-set such that all vertical sections and all horizontal sections have k elements.
references: L. Comtet, Advanced Combinatorics, Reidel, 1974, p. 236, P(n,k).
links: Brendan D. McKay, Rows n = 0..30, flattened
C. J. Everett and P. R. Stein, The asymptotic number of integer stochastic matrices, Disc. Math. 1 (1971), 55-72.
Brendan D. McKay, first 30 rows : entries named Bv[n,k,n,k] (link added by _Wouter Meeussen_, Jan 18 2014)
Wouter Meeussen, relevant entries from B. D. McKay reference
formula: Comtet quotes Everett and Stein as showing that T(n,k) ~ (kn)!(k!)^(-2n) exp( -(k-1)^2/2 ) for fixed k as n -> oo.
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
